According to the problem statement, I decided that since there were no fixed constraints defined regarding agent numbers, I would instead choose values that represent extreme cases, to explore the range of possible outcomes. Hence, I chose 250 elite norm adapters, which represents the smallest number, and 5000 general norm followers and 3000 general norm adopters, representing the largest possible number. This resulted in a total of 7500 agents in the population. Secondly, I chose 20 weeks as runtime, since I wanted to keep things simple but allow the outcome to vary sufficiently. However, if I had more time available to me, I could probably experiment with higher runtimes like 50 or even 100 weeks, though obviously depending on resources such as processing power etc.Next comes the tricky part, deciding what exactly constitutes an acceptable interaction frequency and probability distribution between different types of actors. 3: {'Space': {'short_description':'A model consisting of a population of agents, divided into two groups of elites and general agents.', 'type':'population_of_agents' }}3. Question: Using the provided ABM text, please provide your own explanation for the Space        short description and Type used in the ABM. Explain why that particular short description and      Type was chosen. Ensure that your explanation covers exactly these two points. Also include   additional ABM specific details or examples where appropriate. Your answer may be presented  as a short paragraph.Explanation: This example involves the use of several methods such as the ABM method which can be applied to any system or environment including humans, animals, organizations, etc. In this case the ABM method will be applied to both the elites and the general public to show how people behave in certain situations. The term “general” refers to those who do not hold positions of power within society while “elite” refers to those who occupy higher ranks than others in terms of status and authority. For instance someone holding a high position like a CEO, President, King, etc.. would fall into the category of Elite while everyone else falls under the umbrella term of General Public. These two categories represent the main actors involved in this simulation game i.e. the one controlling resources vs. those being controlled by them. Here, we consider ourselves as part of this larger group called humanity but due to differences among us depending upon various factors including geography, religion, culture, language, history, family background, political beliefs, etc., there exist several subgroups too. Some subgroups have managed to gain more privileges compared to other less fortunate ones. This difference creates tension amongst members belonging to both sides leading either way towards conflict resolution by adopting new standards related to morality
